aboutMe: In 1996-1999, when I was in high school, I worked for an information technology company. Thus, I entered the field of information technologies professionally at a very early age. Afterwards, I completed my education as a Computer Teacher(B.Sc.). and Computer Engineer(M.Sc.). I have worked both in the private sector and in the public sector.

During my years in the private sector, I had significant overseas experience as a software developer. I worked in many countries, especially in Russia. I currently work as a specialist teacher at the Ministry of National Education. Teaching, software development and database management are my important skills.

work.explanation: I teach web programming and basic programming, guide to the school management and teachers on information technologies, take part in the city-wide ceremonies of schools, providing technical support and IT consultancy for these ceremonies and I am responsible for the smart boards (presentation computer with touch screen) of the schools where I work.

ENKA is a construction company operating in many countries. This company uses human resources software developed by its own organization. This software was used for keeping employee records, performance, health and safety monitoring, salary calculation and hourly labor cost calculation. My role in the team responsible for this software; Evaluation of software related requests, coding and testing of requests, determination of the necessary information about the laws of the country where the business is located and integration into the software, selection of personnel to use the program, user training and preparation of consolidated reports requested by management.
